pullRequest.title: PR #1 Low Level API - Add CAs and Properties
pullRequest.bodyText:
First PR for #555

Add utility classes (see old branch):

RepositoryUtility and test case
AServerRepositoryTest


Update ModelAccessResource and add API for:

Accessing a concrete project repository (via it's name)
Accessing CAs
Accessing Properties


Add ModelAccessResourceTest
Add CustomJsonProvider and test case:

Registers classes and event handlers
Wraps unmarshalling into a command that is called via the transactional editing domain

commit.message:
Update ModelAccessResource - (Task #555)

- Add Endpoint for for the repository
- Add first endpoint for a test property
- Add ModelAccessResourceTest and add this class to AllTests
- Add abstract test case AServerRepositoryTest
- Add CustomJsonProvider that get's injected into the
ModelAccessResource and is used to add the stateful adapters with the
current ResourceSet to the Unmarshaller
- Register ModelAccessResource and CustomJsonProvider in the servlet

nodes.bodyText: We can simplify this with the executeAsCommand method in AProjectTestCase
Dont we have some helper function/helper assert that takes care of the whitespaces?

Hmm I guess the t stands for test, but that isnt a 100% clear. Maybe we can rename these to beanString, etc? In the above variables I think its fine because the "Test" actually part of the class name. So when I see tString I first thought we somehow have a class TestString. So this might be a bit misleading.
This line being uncovered seems weird.
There generaly should also be test cases that do not find the requested object.

nodes.bodyText:
Something is off with the exceptions. They are instantiated here, not passed to the readFromCommand and then the readFromCommand has its own exception data.
Maybe we can simplify this by

Completely moving the exception objects into the ReadFromCommand
Making a throwExceptionsIfSet() method in the ReadFromCommand that deals with throwing the indificual exceptions when needed
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -113,27 +113,78 @@ public Object readFrom(Class<Object> type, Type genericType, Annotation[] annota
 		AtomicExceptionReference<IOException> atomicIoException = new AtomicExceptionReference<>();

nodes.bodyText: Why is server depending on unittest util and model.extension.tests? This stuff should be in server.test
nodes.diffHunk:
@@ -33,3 +33,10 @@ Export-Package: de.dlr.sc.virsat.server,
  de.dlr.sc.virsat.server.jetty,
  de.dlr.sc.virsat.server.resources
 Automatic-Module-Name: de.dlr.sc.virsat.server
+Import-Package: de.dlr.sc.virsat.concept.unittest.util.test,

nodes.bodyText: Should we maybe name this class in a way that reflects its function? Like transactional or something :)

Suggested change
        
          
    

        
      
    
    
      
          
            
            	 * Call writeTo and assert that the the output String is as expected
          
          
            
            	 * Call writeTo and assert that the the output String contains the test value
Why are these inner class and not normal classes?
Let's also use our TEST_STRING constant here
